result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Michael Groth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with count 2, current revocation and case 22CM582.  Credit for 6 days time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Michael Groth

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed. NOTICE OF RIGHT TO SEEK POSTCONVICTION RELIEF

Defendant Joshua Michael Groth appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Daniel Mcmurray appeared by video for Joshua Michael Groth.  Prosecuting attorney Ryan Jay Michaels appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Sentencing Hearing.

Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

As to Count 2: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, concurrent to count 3, and to any other sentence, with credit for 6 days served. 

As to Count 3: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, concurrent to count 2, and to any other sentence, with credit for 6 days served. 

CONDITIONS:
- Court set restitution at zero.
- Provide a DNA sample. 
- Defendant to pay all mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges by 08/31/2024. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
- Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
- Any cash bail on deposit to apply if applicable.
- No contact with firearms.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

ADDRESS INFO for Joshua Michael Groth
Current: 601 S 76th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53214 United States  (Effective: 08-16-2022)
Prior: 3838 North 60th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53216

Defendant Joshua Michael Groth in court with attorney Daniel Mcmurray.  Defendant Joshua Michael Groth in custody. Student Intern Jessica Birmingham under the supervision of Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea hearing held.  Court held colloquy with the defendant regarding his right to have an in-person hearing.  Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 1 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3: Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Case adjourned to Branch 29 for Sentencing.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Daniel Mcmurray in court, defendant Joshua Michael Groth not in court, in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a final pre-trial. Defense counsel advises the Court this case is in a resolution posture. Court converts the jury trial on 6/27/22 to a plea hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Daniel Mcmurray in court, defendant Joshua Michael Groth not in court, in custody.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a final pre-trial. For reasons stated on the record, Court adjourns the final pre-trial.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Daniel Mcmurray in court, defendant Joshua Michael Groth not in court, in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 03:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CASE HEARD FOR BR. 29:
Defendant Joshua Michael Groth in court with attorney Daniel Mcmurray.  Defendant Joshua Michael Groth in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties appear by video.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.  
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver, filed.

Court ordered no contact with CAP (1/27/80)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Joshua Michael Groth in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Defendant Joshua Michael Groth in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joshua Michael Groth appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2 and 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE for Branch 29.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
